title.narrative: WATER, SANITATION & HYGIENE (WASH)

description.narrative: Strengthened capacity of children and communities, especially the most vulnerable, to practice safe sanitation, access and use clean drinking water and thrive in a healthy environment., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Regional support and inter-country initiatives contribute to the quality and impact of policy and programmes for the realization of all children's rights in the region, including in humanitarian situations.

title.narrative: Number of countries supported for improved gender/equity sensitive monitoring framework

actual.value: 2015:On-track. - Using DFAT funds i) water quality testing, ii) review of country monitoring systems and iii) exchange events with focus support for improved Joint Monitoring Programme to PNG, Pacific initiated and ongoing, - Jointly with WHO 5 day workshop on Water Safety planning and Post 2015 WASH mon

title.narrative: Number of countries guided in promoting elimination of Open Defecation, adequate sanitation, sanitation marketing and/or hygiene behaviour change programming through policy, strategy and monitoring

actual.value: 2015:On-Track. - 12 countries are implementing CLTS, ODF is now part of national policy in Indonesia, - High level commitment in national plans and strategies in China, Myanmar, Cambodia, Vietnam and Pacific with RO technical support, - Regional CLTS Review indicates that CLTS continues to play an import

title.narrative: Number of learning outputs (publications, training modules, webinars) produced and disseminated

actual.value: 2015:On-track. - 3 separate publications on 2015 regional JMP analysis completed and disseminated, - ? title.narrative: Number of countries supported for improved (equity & gender, resilient, sustainable and cost-effective) WASH programming

actual.value: 2015:On track. - Regular remote and in-country exchanges with COs maintained throughout the year on areas as (joint sector) review, national strategy development funding proposals, advocacy events, - Responded to all CO support requests for technical support, 8 were postponed due to in-country emergencie

title.narrative: Number of countries supported for strengthening WASH emergency preparedness, response, coordination and resilience building

actual.value: 2015:On-Track. - As El Nino phenomenon set in, remote and in-country technical support for EPRP provided to Myanmar, DPRK, PICs, PNG, Vietnam, Cambodia for national capacity building, contingency planning and DRR programming as well as for their response to induced drought and flood, - Two WiE training c
